page.title: 03BIOGRAPHY
page.content: One of Assynts most Senior Citizens is Alistair McKenzie. Born in Glasgow in 1909, he came to Assynt one year later to live in Brackloch. He used to walk to the school with his brothers & sisters. His father was a Crofter as his ancesters before him in Brackloch. Alistair went to Dornoch Academy & Edinburgh University, & served in the Army during the W.W.2. He can remember the steamers coming into Lochinver which served as floating shops. He can remember when 1cwt. of coal cost 7p. & petrol 5p. per gallon. He regards TV. & Radio as being the biggest changes to Assynt in his life. Alistair had to leave Assynt to find work in England but returned to the family croft to retire. He became the District Clerk for many a year after this, & was a well known representative of Assynt on many a Committee.
